Issues.Title: fix(ivy): handle elements with local refs in i18n blocks
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, i18n logic which ensures that elements removed in a translation are also removed in DOM, didn't take into account the fact that elements may have local refs. As a result, remove operation failed, since there is no corresponding tNode found. This commit updates the logic to skip all local refs while going though the list of nodes to ensure that DOM matches elements present in translation.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): handle elements with local refs in i18n blocks" (#33415)

Issues.Title: [wip] Rollup es2015 & then downlevel to es5 for language-service bundle
Issues.Body:
Testing replacing ls_rollup_bundle with the new @bazel/rollup rollup_bunde which can only handle es2015 inputs at the moment (the esm5 re-rooting does not work with it). Instead of rolling up esm5, this PR changes the language-service bundle to be a rollup of es2015 + a babel downlevel step.

The new bundle differs from the original. I'll attach the two for comparison.

Note: this is branched off of https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/33201
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[wip] Rollup es2015 & then downlevel to es5 for language-service bundle" (#33414)

Issues.Title: Param Map for Activated Route Contains Incorrect Param Keys
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? I do not know if this issue existed in previous versions. ### Description Retrieving values from the param map for the activated route does not work as expected. I was following the routing section of the tour of heroes tutorial https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5. After defining the parameterized route for the hero details component, i noticed the details would not appear when clicking on a hero (from both the list and the dashboard). The URL displayed in the address bar was correct (i.e. /heroes/details/11), and the href attribute in the rendered html was also correct. After stepping through the debugger (in VS Code), i discovered that the parameter key in the route map was stored as "id}" instead of id. When i updated my code to retrieve the value passing "id}" as the key name, it worked as expected and the details were displayed for the selected hero. It appears as though one of the ending "}" chars from the binding syntax in the template is not being dropped when the key/value pair is added to the activated route's param map. This issue was found using Firefox 69.0.3 and was not tested in other browsers. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/johnluisi/angular-demo-bug ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Node: 12.13.0

Issues.Title: ngc reports "cli/lib/config/schema" module not found
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?
Angular newb so I have no idea.


### Description
This import fails:

angular/cli/commands/add-impl.d.ts:7:    readonly packageManager: import("../../../../dist-schema/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema").PackageManager;

however:

```
$ ls -al node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.*
[snip] node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.d.ts
[snip] node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.js
[snip] node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.json
```

so the file it probably wants is ```schema.d.ts```.  

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

My package.json scripts includes 
```
    "postinstall": "ngc -p ./angular-metadata.tsconfig.json"
```
so ```npm install``` triggers the ngc which emits the error.

For reference,
angular-maetadata.tsconfig.json is
```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "lib": [
            "dom",
            "es2015"
        ],
        "experimentalDecorators": true,
        "types": [],
        "module": "amd",
        "moduleResolution": "node"
    },
    "include": [
        "node_modules/@angular/**/*"
    ],
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules/@angular/bazel/**",
        "node_modules/@angular/**/schematics/**",
        "node_modules/@angular/**/testing/**",
        "node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/**",
        "node_modules/@angular/common/upgrade*",
        "node_modules/@angular/router/upgrade*"
    ]
}

```

> ngc -p ./angular-metadata.tsconfig.json

node_modules/@angular/cli/commands/add-impl.d.ts(7,37): error TS2307: Cannot find module '../../../../dist-schema/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema'.
```

Issues.Title: build: add ng_benchmark macro to run perf benchmarks
Issues.Body:
this makes running and profiling tests much easier. Example usage:

```
yarn bazel run --define=compile=aot //packages/core/test/render3/perf:noop_change_detection
```

See README.md update for more info.

PS: I considered moving the ng_rollup bundle into the macro but I didn't want to make
  too many changes in this PR. If we find running benchmarks in this way useful, we
  should refactor the build file more, and move the ng_rollup_bundle targets into the
  macro.

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Do not show HTML elements and attrs for ext template
Issues.Body:
This commit removes HTML elements and HTML attributes from the
completions list for external template. This is because these
completions should be handled by the native HTML extension, and not
Angular.

Once we setup TextMate grammar for inline templates, we could remove the
HTML completions completely.

Also added `CompletionKind.HTML_ELEMENT`, since there's already `CompletionKind.HTML_ATTRIBUTE`.

PR closes https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/issues/370

Issues.Title: resolvers don't work if you define them in a separate const
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? Not sure. ### Description In our project we have some routes that share some common resolvers. We'd like to not repeat ourselves and so we made a `const resolvers = {}` for these routes. This works locally on our dev machines with `ng serve`, but once built and published to our dev server we noticed that the resolvers we put in this const were no longer working. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` git clone https://github.com/biltongza/angular-const-resolvers cd angular-const-resolvers ng build -c production ``` Host the resulting build on any web server and navigate to it. Click on Route 1 and Route 2 and observe that the resolvers from `const resolvers` do not work, while the one defined directly in the route config does work. Click on Route 3 to see that all resolvers work if defined directly in the route config. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description

We have several classes like this:

```typescript
class A {
  // some methods
}

@Injectable()
class B extends A {
 // some more methods
}

@NgModule({
  providers: {
    B,
    { provide: A, useExisting: B }
  }
})
class MyModule {}
```

This works fine and allows us to provide several "level of services" to several users, making it easier to test stuff.

But when switching to `providedIn`, it is not possible to do so anymore. One seemingly obvious solution (adding `@Injectable({ providedIn: 'root', useExisting: B })` to class A) does not work because typescript complains about a value being used before being defined.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->
A possible solution would be to add an extra `provideAs` property to `@Injectable`, that would take an array of `ValueProvider` or type/tokens, so we can do something like this:

```typescript
@Injectable({
  provideIn: "root"
  provideAs: [A]
})
class B {
}
```

As a bonus, it would also make it possible to use the same facility for injection tokens, which would also be nice.

```typescript
@Injectable({
  providedIn: "root",
  provideAs: [{ provide: HTTP_INTERCEPTORS, multi: true }]
})
class MyInterceptor {
}
```

Maybe an extra key would be needed if someone wants to tweak the behaviour between `useExisting`-style and `useClass`-style.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

The current alternative is sticking to `NgModule`-based provider definition.

Issues.Title: FormGroup reset() throws error if a control is removed based on a valueChanges subscription
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms ### Is this a regression? Not sure. ### Description On a FormGroup, we have two FormControl, where the second is shown when, and only when first field has a value. To achieve this, we're subscribing to the first control valueChanges observable, and if there's no value (and the second control exists), we remove the second one; if there's a value (and the second control doesn't exist yet), we add the second control. We also have a button that allows us to reset the form to the initial state. Problem occurs when we reset, where an error is thrown. This happens because the second control is still part of the form group's dictionary of named controls, but the value is _undefined_ (and it tries to call 'reset' of _undefined_). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-p1nwkd ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: TemplateRef passed into other component not checked under Ivy
Issues.Body:
üêû bug report ### Affected Package angular 9 with ivy ### Is this a regression? yes ### Description I check the Ivy Minor Change docs here https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Dije0AsJ0PxL3NaeNPxpYDeapj30b_QC0xfeIvIIzgg/preview and found that >If a template is declared in one view but inserted into a different view, change detection will occur for that template only when its insertion point is checked (previously, change detection would also run when its declaration point was checked). It will bring lots of break changes to our UI library when upgrading it to angular 9 with ivy, because of many components' input support both `string` and `TemplateRef` type, and all components are working under OnPush mode. When the user passes a TemplateRef with a variable to the component, the template inside the component won't update any longer even if the variable has changed outside the component, which is a very common situation. For example the select API here: https://ng.ant.design/components/select/en#api Property | Description | Type | Default -- | -- | -- | -- [nzNotFoundContent] | Specify content to show when no result matches.. | string \| `TemplateRef` | 'Not Found' The feature comes from a directive here: https://github.com/NG-ZORRO/ng-zorro-antd/blob/master/components/core/addon/string_template_outlet.ts#L24 which brought a lot of convenience to the user. I wonder if it is possible to keep the same as the previous version of the template check behavior Thanks a lot ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction it works with angular 8 in the stackblitz, but not work under 9.0.0-next https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-99qln5?file=src/app/hello.component.ts I could not enable ivy in stackblitz, so there is no online repro here. Download and upgrade all `@angular/*`, you can find the name inside the component is `Angular`, but the outside name is `Angular Next` after 3 sec. ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): find expression ASTs using absolute spans
Issues.Body:
Moves to using the absolute span of an expression AST (relative to an
entire template) rather than a relative span (relative to the start
of the expression) to find an expression AST given a position in a
template.

This is part of the changes needed to support text replacement in
templates (#33091).

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>angular/angular</summary>

### [`v9.0.0-next.14`](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​900-next14httpsgithubcomangularangularcompare900-next13900-next14-2019-10-25)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/compare/9.0.0-next.13...9.0.0-next.14)

##### Bug Fixes

-   **core:** missing-injectable migration should handle forwardRef ([#​33286](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33286)) ([eeecbf2](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/eeecbf2))
-   **core:** missing-injectable migration should not migrate providers with "useExisting" ([#​33286](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33286)) ([4d23b60](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/4d23b60))
-   **core:** missing-injectable migration should not update type definitions ([#​33286](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33286)) ([335854f](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/335854f))
-   **ivy:** allow abstract directives to have an invalid constructor ([#​32987](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/32987)) ([8d15bfa](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/8d15bfa)), closes [#​32981](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/32981)
-   **ivy:** fix broken typechecking test on Windows ([#​33376](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33376)) ([63f0ded](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/63f0ded))
-   **ivy:** split checkTypeOfReferences into DOM and non-DOM flags. ([#​33365](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33365)) ([113411c](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/113411c))
-   **ivy:** support abstract directives in template type checking ([#​33131](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33131)) ([a42057d](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/a42057d)), closes [#​30080](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/30080)
-   **language-service:** Do not show HTML elements and attrs for ext template ([#​33388](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33388)) ([a78b701](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/a78b701))
-   **ngcc:** prevent reflected decorators from being clobbered ([#​33362](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33362)) ([0de2dbf](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/0de2dbf))

##### Features

-   **ivy:** add a runtime feature to copy cmp/dir definitions ([#​33362](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33362)) ([818c514](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/818c514))
-   **ivy:** add flag to disable checking of text attributes ([#​33365](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33365)) ([d8ce212](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/d8ce212))
-   **ivy:** allow the locale to be set via a global property ([#​33314](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33314)) ([fde8363](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/fde8363))
-   **ivy:** i18n - inline current locale at compile-time ([#​33314](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33314)) ([fb84ea7](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/fb84ea7))
-   **ivy:** input type coercion for template type-checking ([#​33243](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33243)) ([f1269d9](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/f1269d9))
-   **ivy:** strictness flags for template type checking ([#​33365](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33365)) ([0d9be22](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/0d9be22))
-   **ivy:** verify whether TypeScript version is supported ([#​33377](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33377)) ([4aa51b7](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/4aa51b7))
-   **ngcc:** add a migration for undecorated child classes ([#​33362](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33362)) ([b381497](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/b381497))
-   **ngcc:** enable migrations to apply schematics to libraries ([#​33362](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33362)) ([6b26748](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/6b26748))
-   **ngcc:** migrate services that are missing `@Injectable()` ([#​33362](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33362)) ([31b9492](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/31b9492))

##### Performance Improvements

-   **ivy:** apply [style]/[class] bindings directly to style/className ([#​33336](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33336)) ([dcdb433](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/dcdb433))
-   **ivy:** apply static styles/classes directly to an element's style/className properties ([#​33364](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33364)) ([5607ad8](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/5607ad8))
-   **ivy:** improve styling performance ([#​33326](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/33326)) ([d40ee6a](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/d40ee6a))

</details>

Issues.Title: ng update fails on latest angular cli
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? N/A ### Description ng update --all fails on a new project ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. install latest angular cli `yarn global add @angular/cli ` 2. create a new project `ng new projectname` 3. cd into project 4. run `ng update --all` 5. observe We shouldn't have any incompatible peer dependencies. We have two: 1. Package "@angular/core" has an incompatible peer dependency to "zone.js" (requires "~0.9.1", would install "0.10.2"). 2. Package "@angular/compiler-cli" has an incompatible peer dependency to "typescript" (requires ">=3.4 <3.6", would install "3.6.4"). ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): only ngcc in prepare
Issues.Body: This fix is to make is so an npm/yarn install with --production mode will not fail as ngcc won't have been installed yet. This allows for workflows with docker and other production build mechanics.

Issues.Title: build: update autoprefixer to version 9.7.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [autoprefixer](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer) | dependencies | minor | [`9.6.5` -> `9.7.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/autoprefixer/9.6.5/9.7.0) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/autoprefixer ### [`v9.7.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/releases/9.7.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/compare/9.6.5...9.7.0) Autoprefixer 9.7 brings `AUTOPREFIXER_GRID` environment variable and huge performance improvments. #### Grid Environment Variable Autoprefixer can add [CSS Grid polyfills for IE](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer#does-autoprefixer-polyfill-grid-layout-for-ie). You need to manually enable it to prove that you understand the limits of polyfill. In previous versions you can enable Grid polyfill by `grid: 'autoplace'` option or¬†by¬†`/* autoprefixer grid: autoplace */` control comment. But in some cases, developers were not able to use both methods. For instance, during [work with Material UI‚Äô CSS-in-JS in Create React App](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/issues/1257). Now Autoprefixer supports environment variable to enable CSS Grid polyfill: ```sh AUTOPREFIXER_GRID=autoplace npm build ``` #### Performance Improvements [@​Knagis](https://togithub.com/Knagis) [found](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/issues/1256) that Browserslist takes 70% of the Autoprefixer time. ![Autoprefixer 9.6.5 profiling](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19343/67489064-e0a10400-f6ab-11e9-895b-1507608e2446.png) We did a lot of improvements in Browserslist and now Autoprefixer should work much faster. ![67417985-a283e180-f5d2-11e9-879a-e364c9acccf1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19343/67489142-01695980-f6ac-11e9-96a2-c2cc169b6767.png) #### Other - Fix [`Cannot read property 'grid' of undefined`](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/issues/1244) error
--- ### Renovate configuration :date: **Schedule**: "after 10pm every weekday,before 4am every weekday,every weekend" in timezone America/Tijuana. :vertical_traffic_light: **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied. :recycle: **Rebasing**: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or if you modify the PR title to begin with "`rebase!`". :no_bell: **Ignore**: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about this update again. --- - [ ] If you want to rebase/retry this PR, check this box --- This PR has been generated by [Renovate Bot](https://togithub.com/marketplace/renovate). ### [`v2.0.0`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/releases/v2.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/compare/v1.20.0...v2.0.0)

#### Big changes

-   Chromium 79.0.3942.0 (r705776)
-   Puppeteer now requires Node.js v8+; Node.js v6 is no longer supported
-   `page.screenshot` now clips elements to the viewport ([#​5080](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5080))
-   New APIs:
    -   [`page.emulateTimezone(timezoneId)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatetimezonetimezoneid)
    -   [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) (superseding the old [`page.emulateMedia(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatype) API)
    -   [`page.emulateMediaFeatures(features)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype)

#### API changes

-   New API: [`page.emulateTimezone(timezoneId)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatetimezonetimezoneid) ([#​4949](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4949))
-   New API: [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))
-   Deprecated API: [`page.emulateMedia(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatype) is now obsolete. Use [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) instead. ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/schematics): remove several deprecated APIs
Issues.Body:
refactor(@angular-devkit/schematics): remove several deprecated APIs

BREAKING CHANGE:

Removed several deprecated APIs:

- EngineHost `listSchematics` has been removed in favour of `listSchematicNames`.
- `FileSystemSink` - Use the new virtualFs.Host classes from `@angular-devkit/core`.
- `optimize` function has been remove as trees are automaticlly optimized.
- `DryRunSink` deprecated constructor that allowed to provide a directory path has been removed. Provide a `virtualFs.Host` instead.

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.23.0...1.23.1)

-   Fix a bug preventing built-in modules from being loaded within a configured
    module.

-   Fix a bug preventing an unconfigured module from being loaded from within two
    different configured modules.

-   Fix a bug when `meta.load-css()` was used to load some files that included
    media queries.

-   Allow `saturate()` in plain CSS files, since it can be used as a plain CSS
    filter function.

-   Improve the error messages for trying to access functions like `lighten()`
    from the `sass:color` module.

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ``` - [x ] serve - [x ] generate - [ x] update - [ x] run - [ x] config ``` ### Is this a regression? This is an upgrade from a production app in Angular v5.1 webpack v2.5 to Angular v7.0 webpack v4.41 ### Description Getting the configuration correct for webpack v4.41 to run with Angular v7.0 is causing lots of erros ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 

Webpack v2.5 to v4.41 upgrade ERRORS (w/ Angular v5.1 to v7.0 upgrade)
(keep in mind, we are hoping to upgrade to Angular v8.2 ultimately but update.angular.io suggests an incremental upgrade 
and have not gotten to Angular v7 successfully - yet)

Having a bear of a time getting the upgrade of my Angular app from v5.1 to v8.2 to work due to move to webpack v4

process:
1. follow all the instructions on update.angular.io
2. delete folder node_modules
3. delete npm-shrinkwrap.json
4. npm install

Issues.Title: ng generate module produce wrong code for specific code pattern
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [x] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description The `ng generate module` produce wrong code. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ```sh ng new demo1 --routing --style css cd demo1 ng g c test1 ``` Add route config in `src/app/app-routing.module.ts` just like below: ```ts const route1 = { path: 'test1', component: Test1Component }; const routes: Routes = [ route1 ]; ``` Then I creating an lazy-loaded module named `test`. ```sh ng g module test --route test --module app ``` Then the route config will turn into this. And this is wrong. ```ts const route1 = { path: 'test1', component: Test1Component }; const routes: Routes = [, { path: 'test', loadChildren: () => import('./test/test.module').then(m => m.TestModule) } route1 ]; ``` ## üî• Exception or Error

Thanks

Sean.

Issues.Title: Incorrect work of drag-and-drop with ng-container in ivy
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction repo for reproducing: https://github.com/nmatushevskiy/ivy-ng-container-bug-repro/ Steps to reproduce: 1. npm i 2. ng serve 3. Try dragging any item #### Expected Behavior Items being dragged correctly with using ng-container https://stackblitz.com/github/nmatushevskiy/ivy-ng-container-bug-repro (example without ivy) Code example: ```
{{item}}
``` #### Actual Behavior Dragging works incorrectly with using ng-container and ivy. With this code: ```
{{item}}
``` Have the following behavior: ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 17 49 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67580994-e8b27f80-f74f-11e9-9c1e-08692577b30b.png) And this, if I try to drag a few items: ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 17 49 40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67581009-ed773380-f74f-11e9-9b8e-f941369a2008.png) #### Environment - Angular: 9.0.0-next.13 - CDK/Material: 8.2.3 / 9.0.0-next.0 (I tried both) - Browser(s): Chrome v. 78.0.3904.70 - Operating System: macOS #### Workaround drag and drop works correct without ng-container. For example: ```
{{item}}
``` #### Comment By debugging established: in `drop-list.ts` (https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/directives/drop-list.ts) in `ngAfterContentInit` method there are no items: ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 18 32 07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67584542-92950a80-f756-11e9-9f41-0207eeffb72a.png) While without ivy all items received: ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 18 35 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67584683-d6880f80-f756-11e9-9f0c-79e61b04f344.png) Also, with ivy doesn't work output `cdkDropListDropped`. By comparing code with and without ivy it was found out: in `drag-ref.ts` (https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/drag-ref.ts) in method `_endDragSequence`, `this._dragDropRegistry.isDragging` returns false, so the code below is not being executed. Thats why the output is not called. ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 18 48 33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67585959-3bdd0000-f759-11e9-9a6e-187bb6898889.png) While without ivy `this._dragDropRegistry.isDragging` returns true and output called correctly ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 18 58 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67586131-8e1e2100-f759-11e9-9d6f-79f301c2e47c.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect work of drag-and-drop with ng-container in ivy" (#17505)

Issues.Title: MatTabGroup - Add ability to intercept tab changes
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

As a developer, I would like a way to intercept tab changes in mat-tab-group and prevent the change under certain conditions

#### Use Case

This feature would enable us to stop tab changes if a form in the tab is dirty or invalid, show a pop-up, and prevent the tab change based on the user decision.

Issues.Title: '@angular/material/index.d.ts' is not a module
Issues.Body:

Issues.Body:
We currently only run tests against Ivy due to the
commit that switched the `--define=compile` flag.

are doing the same. Instead we should change `ivy_test` to

Issues.Title: ivy: Boolean inputs cause compile errors
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

(StackBlitz doesn't seem to support ivy)

Steps to reproduce:
1. `npm install -g @angular/cli@next`
2. `ng new app`
3. `ng add @angular/material`
4. `ng update @angular/material --next`
5. Add a basic [button example](https://material.angular.io/components/button/examples) with a boolean input:

```html
<button mat-button disabled>Disabled</button>
```
 
#### Expected Behavior
The build should pass

#### Actual Behavior
```
ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:339:22 - error TS2322: Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'boolean'.

339   <button mat-button disabled>Disabled</button>
                         ~~~~~~~~

  src/app/app.component.ts:5:16
    5   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
```

This usage is prevalent in Material and CDK (e.g. `cdkTrapFocus`), so it's causing a lot of errors for consumers experimenting with ivy. Any input that relies on [`coerceBooleanProperty()`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/cd0a47e204c20481bf3534c9f1046049eaa63308/src/cdk/coercion/boolean-property.ts#L10) is subject to this problem.

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.0-next.13
- CDK/Material: 9.0.0-next.0
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ivy: Boolean inputs cause compile errors" (#17495)

Issues.Title: using a getter result for mat-select options causes an infinite loop
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

When I use a getter in some component to provide the options for a `mat-select` in a child component it causes an infinite loop. The child component `ngOnChanges` is being called all the time.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I didn't expect to create an infinite loop because if I use a simple `select` it works as expected.

#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-civfkw?file=app%2Fchild.component.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Uncomment the block to use the `mat-select`.
2. The application became unresponsive üòû 
  
#### Environment

- Angular: ^8.0.0
- CDK/Material: ^8.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "using a getter result for mat-select options causes an infinite loop" (#17493)

Issues.Title: MatCardContent selector
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Give `MatCardContent` a selector like `MatDialogContent`:

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/11a4ff0a6d08e225d4b1f70d21bb0dde8011ae9a/src/material/dialog/dialog-content-directives.ts#L111

so like:

```ts
  selector: '[mat-card-content], mat-card-content, [matCardContent]',
```

#### Use Case
So that when the content of the card's content is just a root element 

```html
<mat-card>
  <mat-card-title>My Tite</mat-card-title>
  <mat-card-content>
    <some-root-element></some-root-element>
  </mat-card-content>
</mat-card>
```

vs

```html
<mat-card>
  <mat-card-title>My Tite</mat-card-title>
  <some-root-element matCardContent></some-root-element>
</mat-card>
```

there isn't un-necessary nesting
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatCardContent selector" (#17487)

Issues.Title: fix(checkbox): unknown property warning with Ivy during server-side rendering
Issues.Body:
Ivy's check for whether a property supported is basically `if (propName in element)` which logs a warning if it doesn't match. It seems like Domino hasn't implemented the `indeterminate` property for `input` so Angular ends up logging a warning during server-side rendering. These changes switch to setting the property directly to avoid using a property binding.

Also fixes that the current Material checkbox wasn't coercing the `indeterminate` input to a boolean.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(checkbox): unknown property warning with Ivy during server-side rendering" (#17485)
